messages: 443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:06): podzap: why would anyone be against rac
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (01:07): i'm just gathering opinions about pros and cons
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:07): and the cost may turn out to be the best money your company ever spent
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (01:08): i'm worried about interconnect latency bottlenecks
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:08): i've never heard about any real issues in that area
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:08): oracle actually advices against myrinet or infiniband
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:09): 10GE is the best option for low latency
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:10): i don't have any figures in my head.. low enough
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:11): i'd say 75% of all rac interconnects are very basic ethernet cards.. intel pro1000, broadcom etc
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (01:11): do you believe that 8 x 4-way machines in a rac cluster would outperform a single 32-way machine?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:11): but it will cost a fifth
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (01:12): you can get an ibm x460 32-way for 100k USD
2fcc1af54942f1bdefc18f4e88f2ac7c (01:13): has anyone heard of using Oracle Streams -> MS SQL?  For some reason I thought it was possible.
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:13): podzap: isn't that a numa system?
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:13): Mr_You: it sort of is.. Oacle Gateway for SQL Server
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:14): podzap: since the x460 is a 3U box :)
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:14): podzap: and i strongly doubt you'll get more than 8 procs for 100k
2fcc1af54942f1bdefc18f4e88f2ac7c (01:15): damn cool boxes, but I wish the industry would come out with an interconnect+BIOS like that.
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (01:15): i can get an 8-way box with 64gb of ram for 26K USD
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:15): Mr_You: how many chassis do you have linked?
2fcc1af54942f1bdefc18f4e88f2ac7c (01:15): hali: you think that thing would "XpandOnDemand(R)" for any OS?  They claim support for Linux and Windows only.
2fcc1af54942f1bdefc18f4e88f2ac7c (01:15): hali: I don't even know if we'll need it... basicaly management not knowing technical shit and realizing how much of a gain 10gR2 is over 8i.
2fcc1af54942f1bdefc18f4e88f2ac7c (01:16): But the box won't even run our old Oracle 8i setup anyways haha
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:17): Mr_You: how warm is it up where you are?
2fcc1af54942f1bdefc18f4e88f2ac7c (01:17): it was hot and humid for like the 20 minutes I was out side, got back outside and cool and rainy.
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (01:18): i'm thinking of going to Tunis in July/August
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:18): tunis is probably to hot that time of year
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:19): i would pay to get out of that :)
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (01:19): yeah, but it'll be nice in the sheraton
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:20): and the bbc website show the five day forecast with a 23C min :(
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:20): and a high polution index in london
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (01:21): and heathrow is the worst airport in the world...
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:22): it's good compared to lets say new delhi ;)
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (01:22): mumbai airport is better than heathrow
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (01:22): st. petersburg was quite bad as well
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (01:22): i was in mumbai in march and it was easy to get in, easy to walk around, easy to navigate, etc.
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (01:22): heathrow is a freakin bureaucratic nightmare
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (01:25): well i stand up next to the edge of a mountain, and i chop her down with the edge of my hand...
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (01:25): then i pick up all the pieces and make a little island
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (02:05): not even the aussies here drink fosters :)
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (02:06): i got a case of cold fosters!
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (02:09): hmm, for the first time ever im disapointed with macos x
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (02:09): i can't connect my external LCD and use a different resolution than i have on the laptop display
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (02:10): x.org / xfree86 is the same way mostly
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (02:10): so my nice 19" LCD has got black borders to cope with the puny 1024x786 resolution :(
443a9547033ec9d695ae9d29e8df98b1 (02:11): but at least Xorg will do it with some hacking around
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (02:11): i got this 19" LCD widescreen model from fujitsu-siemens
3cd66495a6444eeee403b7d3983ba112 (02:12): it's ok as long as you don't look at it sideways
